1.verse: From Paul, who is in jail for serving Christ Jesus, and from Timothy, who is like a brother because of our faith. Philemon, you work with us and are very dear to us. This letter is to you

2.verse: and to the church that meets in your home. It is also to our dear friend Apphia and to Archippus, who serves the Lord as we do.

3.verse: I pray that God our Father and our Lord Jesus Christ will be kind to you and will bless you with peace!

4.verse: Philemon’s Love and Faith - Philemon, each time I mention you in my prayers, I thank God.

5.verse: I hear about your faith in our Lord Jesus and about your love for all of God’s people.

6.verse: As you share your faith with others, I pray that they may come to know all the blessings Christ has given us.

7.verse: My friend, your love has made me happy and has greatly encouraged me. It has also cheered the hearts of God’s people.

8.verse: Paul Speaks to Philemon about Onesimus - Christ gives me the courage to tell you what to do.

9.verse: But I would rather ask you to do it simply because of love. Yes, as someone in jail for Christ,

10.verse: I beg you to help Onesimus! He is like a son to me because I led him to Christ here in jail.

11.verse: Before this, he was useless to you, but now he is useful both to you and to me.

12.verse: Sending Onesimus back to you makes me very sad.

13.verse: I would like to keep him here with me, where he could take your place in helping me while I am here in prison for preaching the good news.

14.verse: But I won’t do anything unless you agree to it first. I want your act of kindness to come from your heart, and not be something you feel forced to do.

15.verse: Perhaps Onesimus was taken from you for a little while so that you could have him back for good,

16.verse: but not as a slave. Onesimus is much more than a slave. To me he is a dear friend, but to you he is even more, both as a person and as a follower of the Lord.

17.verse: If you consider me a friend because of Christ, then welcome Onesimus as you would welcome me.

18.verse: If he has cheated you or owes you anything, charge it to my account.

19.verse: With my own hand I write: I, PAUL, WILL PAY YOU BACK. But don’t forget that you owe me your life.

20.verse: My dear friend and follower of Christ our Lord, please cheer me up by doing this for me.

21.verse: I am sure you will do all I have asked, and even more.

22.verse: Please get a room ready for me. I hope your prayers will be answered, and I can visit you.

23.verse: Epaphras is also here in jail for being a follower of Christ Jesus. He sends his greetings,

24.verse: and so do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, who work together with me.

25.verse: I pray that the Lord Jesus Christ will be kind to you!
